{"step_by_step_thinking": "The curve passing through the buccal and lingual cusp tips of the mandibular buccal teeth is known as the Curve of Spee. The Curve of Spee is an anatomic curvature of the occlusal alignment of the teeth, beginning at the tip of the lower incisor, following the buccal cusps of the natural premolars and molars and continuing to the anterior border of the ramus. It is named after Ferdinand Graf von Spee, who first described the anatomic relations of human teeth in the sagittal plane.", "answer_choice": "C"}
